Algorithm to layout children as tiles in rows and columns.

Constructor

new(?startDir : prime.core.geom.space.Direction, ?maxTiles : Int, ?horDirection : prime.core.geom.space.Horizontal, ?verDirection : prime.core.geom.space.Vertical)

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

algorithmChanged(default,null) : prime.signals.Signal0

inherited from prime.layout.algorithms.LayoutAlgorithmBase

columns(default,null) : TileContainer

Columns is a TileContainer containing a reference to each column (also TileContainer). The columns property is responsible for setting the correct x position of each column. columns (TileContainer) -> children (ListCollection) -> column0 (TileContainer) -> children (ChainedList) -> column1 (TileContainer) -> children (ChainedList) -> etc.

group(default,accessor) : prime.layout.ILayoutContainer

inherited from prime.layout.algorithms.LayoutAlgorithmBase

horAlgorithm(default,accessor) : IHorizontalAlgorithm

inherited from prime.layout.algorithms.DynamicLayoutAlgorithm

horizontalDirection(default,accessor) : prime.core.geom.space.Horizontal

inherited from prime.layout.algorithms.DynamicLayoutAlgorithm
Defines the start position on the horizontal axis.

maxTilesInDirection(default,accessor) : Int

Maximum number of rows or columns that the layout can have. When the start-direction is 'horizontal', the value will be used as the max number of columns. The number of rows will vary on the number of items. When the start-direction is 'vertical', the value will be used as the maxmimum number or rows. The number of columns will vary on the number of items.

rows(default,null) : TileContainer

The maximum width of each tile. Their orignal width will be ignored if the tile is bigger then this number (it won't get resized).

startDirection(default,accessor) : prime.core.geom.space.Direction

inherited from prime.layout.algorithms.tile.TileAlgorithmBase
Defines in which direction the layout will start calculating.

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

apply() : Void

overrides prime.layout.algorithms.DynamicLayoutAlgorithm

createTileMap() : Void

Method will create a new index of all the children of the group. It will calculate the rows and columns on which each child will be. For creating the tilemap it doesn't matter if it's horizontal or vertical. The variable names below just describe the horizontal direction.. At the end of this method the properties will be switched when it turns out to be a vertical list.
